segment.source: This topic for the IT professional lists the various application control scenarios in which AppLocker policies can be effectively implemented.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional lists the various application control scenarios in which AppLocker policies can be effectively implemented.

segment.source: AppLocker can help you improve the management of application control and the maintenance of application control policies.
segment.target: AppLocker can help you improve the management of application control and the maintenance of application control policies.

segment.source: Application control scenarios addressed by AppLocker can be categorized as follows:
segment.target: Application control scenarios addressed by AppLocker can be categorized as follows:

segment.source: App inventory
segment.target: App inventory

segment.source: AppLocker has the ability to enforce its policy in an audit-only mode where all app access activity is collected in event logs for further analysis.
segment.target: AppLocker has the ability to enforce its policy in an audit-only mode where all app access activity is collected in event logs for further analysis.

segment.source: Windows PowerShell cmdlets are also available to help you understand app usage and access.
segment.target: Windows PowerShell cmdlets are also available to help you understand app usage and access.

segment.source: Protection against unwanted software
segment.target: Protection against unwanted software

segment.source: AppLocker has the ability to deny apps from running simply by excluding them from the list of allowed apps per business group or user.
segment.target: AppLocker has the ability to deny apps from running simply by excluding them from the list of allowed apps per business group or user.

segment.source: If an app is not specifically identified by its publisher, installation path, or file hash, the attempt to run the application fails.
segment.target: If an app is not specifically identified by its publisher, installation path, or file hash, the attempt to run the application fails.

segment.source: Licensing conformance
segment.target: Licensing conformance

segment.source: AppLocker can provide an inventory of software usage within your organization, so you can identify the software that corresponds to your software licensing agreements and restrict application usage based on licensing agreements.
segment.target: AppLocker can provide an inventory of software usage within your organization, so you can identify the software that corresponds to your software licensing agreements and restrict application usage based on licensing agreements.

segment.source: Software standardization
segment.target: Software standardization

segment.source: AppLocker policies can be configured to allow only supported or approved apps to run on computers within a business group.
segment.target: AppLocker policies can be configured to allow only supported or approved apps to run on computers within a business group.

segment.source: This permits a more uniform app deployment.
segment.target: This permits a more uniform app deployment.

segment.source: Manageability improvement
segment.target: Manageability improvement

segment.source: AppLocker policies can be modified and deployed through your existing Group Policy infrastructure and can work in conjunction with policies created by using Software Restriction Policies.
segment.target: AppLocker policies can be modified and deployed through your existing Group Policy infrastructure and can work in conjunction with policies created by using Software Restriction Policies.

segment.source: As you manage ongoing change in your support of a business group's apps, you can modify policies and use the AppLocker cmdlets to test the policies for the expected results.
segment.target: As you manage ongoing change in your support of a business group's apps, you can modify policies and use the AppLocker cmdlets to test the policies for the expected results.

segment.source: You can also design application control policies for situations in which users share computers.
segment.target: You can also design application control policies for situations in which users share computers.

segment.source: Use scenarios
segment.target: Use scenarios

segment.source: The following are examples of scenarios in which AppLocker can be used:
segment.target: The following are examples of scenarios in which AppLocker can be used:

segment.source: Your organization implements a policy to standardize the applications used within each business group, so you need to determine the expected usage compared to the actual usage.
segment.target: Your organization implements a policy to standardize the applications used within each business group, so you need to determine the expected usage compared to the actual usage.

segment.source: The security policy for application usage has changed, and you need to evaluate where and when those deployed apps are being accessed.
segment.target: The security policy for application usage has changed, and you need to evaluate where and when those deployed apps are being accessed.

segment.source: Your organization's security policy dictates the use of only licensed software, so you need to determine which apps are not licensed or prevent unauthorized users from running licensed software.
segment.target: Your organization's security policy dictates the use of only licensed software, so you need to determine which apps are not licensed or prevent unauthorized users from running licensed software.

segment.source: An app is no longer supported by your organization, so you need to prevent it from being used by everyone.
segment.target: An app is no longer supported by your organization, so you need to prevent it from being used by everyone.

segment.source: Your organization needs to restrict the use of Universal Windows apps to just those your organization approves of or develops.
segment.target: Your organization needs to restrict the use of Universal Windows apps to just those your organization approves of or develops.

segment.source: The potential that unwanted software can be introduced in your environment is high, so you need to reduce this threat.
segment.target: The potential that unwanted software can be introduced in your environment is high, so you need to reduce this threat.

segment.source: The license to an app has been revoked or is expired in your organization, so you need to prevent it from being used by everyone.
segment.target: The license to an app has been revoked or is expired in your organization, so you need to prevent it from being used by everyone.

segment.source: A new app or a new version of an app is deployed, and you need to allow certain groups to use it.
segment.target: A new app or a new version of an app is deployed, and you need to allow certain groups to use it.

segment.source: Specific software tools are not allowed within the organization, or only specific users have access to those tools.
segment.target: Specific software tools are not allowed within the organization, or only specific users have access to those tools.

segment.source: A single user or small group of users needs to use a specific app that is denied for all others.
segment.target: A single user or small group of users needs to use a specific app that is denied for all others.

segment.source: Some computers in your organization are shared by people who have different software usage needs.
segment.target: Some computers in your organization are shared by people who have different software usage needs.

segment.source: In addition to other measures, you need to control the access to sensitive data through app usage.
segment.target: In addition to other measures, you need to control the access to sensitive data through app usage.
